text: You, too, women, cast away all the cowards from your embraces they will give you only cowards for children, and you who are the daughters of the land of beauty must bear children who are noble and brave.
author: Giuseppe Garibaldi

text: All my writing is about the recognition that there is no single reality. But the beauty of it is that you nevertheless go on, walking towards utopia, which may not exist, on a bridge which might end before you reach the other side.
author: Marguerite Young

text: I thought it might be a good move to get into a beauty contest so I tried for Miss Pennsylvania and won. I think that helped me get noticed, at least by the people of Pennsylvania.
author: Sharon Stone

text: The beauty of a strong, lasting commitment is often best understood by men incapable of it.
author: Murray Kempton

text: What I like about cities is that everything is king size, the beauty and the ugliness.
author: Joseph Brodsky
